simple_fraction: Of the ${total} students in ${name}'s class at school, 1/2 of them are girls. How many girls are in the class?
${name} has ${total} ${items} in ${his_her} collection. ${subj} decide${verb_s} to give 1/4 of them to ${his_her} friend as a gift. How many ${items} does ${name} give away?
There are ${total} ${items} in a basket on the kitchen counter. If ${name} takes 1/3 of them for a snack, how many ${items} ${does_do} ${subject} take?
A large pizza has ${total} slices in total. ${name} eats 1/4 of the pizza for dinner. How many slices ${does_do} ${subject} eat?
${name} had ${total} ${items} saved up from various purchases. ${subj} sold 1/2 of them at a garage sale last weekend. How many ${items} did ${subject} sell?
fraction_remaining: ${name} had ${total} ${items} that ${subject} bought from the store. ${subj} gave 1/4 of them to ${his_her} sister and 1/2 of what was left to ${his_her} brother. How many ${items} does ${name} have now?
Of the ${total} ${items} in the container, ${name} used 1/3 for a project at school. Of the remaining ${items}, ${subject} gave half to a friend. How many ${items} does ${name} have left?
${name} bought ${total} ${items} at the grocery store. ${subj} ate 1/4 of them on Monday and 1/3 of the remainder on Tuesday. How many ${items} are left for the rest of the week?
There were ${total} cookies in the jar on the kitchen counter. ${name} ate 1/2 of them after school. Then ${his_her} friend came over and ate 1/4 of what was left. How many cookies remain in the jar?
fraction_compare: ${name1} has ${total} ${items} in ${his_her1} collection. ${name2} has 1/2 as many ${items} as ${name1} because ${subject2} started collecting more recently. How many ${items} does ${name2} have?
If ${name1} has ${total} ${items} and ${name2} has 1/3 as many because ${subject2} prefer${verb_s2} quality over quantity, how many ${items} do they have together?
${name1} earned $${total} from ${his_her1} summer job. ${name2} earned 1/4 as much because ${subject2} worked fewer hours. How much did ${name2} earn?
${name1} collected ${total} ${items} over the summer vacation. ${name2} collected 1/2 as many, and ${name3} collected 1/4 as many as ${name1}. How many ${items} did they collect in total?
